definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: When was the last time you flashed a fake smile at the office?
sentences.chinese: 你在办公室的最近一次假笑一闪而过是什么时候呢？

sentences.english: A small brilliant bird flashed into view.
sentences.chinese: 一只色彩斑澜的小鸟从眼前一闪而过。

sentences.english: It almost seems like a flash to heaven.
sentences.chinese: 这看起来几乎就像是天堂一闪而过。

sentences.english: Kong Jue, one flashing red star.
sentences.chinese: 孔厥，一闪而过的红色星斗。

sentences.english: Many of those dashed hopes I shared.
sentences.chinese: 我体会过许多一闪而过的希望。
她脸上的笑容一闪而过。

sentences.english: I glimpsed Amber among the crowd just now.
sentences.chinese: 我刚才在人群中看到采洁一闪而过。

sentences.english: Their heads and shoulders slid across the view through the windowpanes.
sentences.chinese: 他们的头和肩膀在窗玻璃前一闪而过。

sentences.english: I saw a flash of kingfisher blue. A monitor lizard paddled away through the reeds.
sentences.chinese: 我看见一只翠鸟一闪而过，一头巨蜥在芦苇丛中走过。

sentences.english: Sometimes we don't take the time to appreciate the beauty that is quickly passing us by.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我们不会花时间去欣赏车窗外一闪而过的美景。

sentences.english: Occasionally, a tiny flicker of light passes quickly by , its source a mystery.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔有一个来路不明的微小光点一闪而过。

sentences.english: The cars flashed by; I could not count them.
sentences.chinese: 汽车一闪而过，我无法数清数目。

definition: to flash through (one's mind)/to dodge (away from pursuers)
to flit across/to sweep past/to glance (strike at an angle)
(of a meteor etc) to streak across (the sky)/(of a searchlight, lightning etc) to play across (the sky)
one instant/very short time/the twinkle of an eye
in the twinkling of an eye/in a flash/to turn one's eyes
to appear before one's eyes/to come into view/to float into appearance/to come back (of images from the past)/to emerge/it emerges/it occurs (to me that..)
